By continuing to browse the site you are agreeing to our   use of cookies. Korean pop culture has taken the world by storm and has increasingly become popular in India as well. In Bengaluru alone, there are around 10 such fan groups with around 3000 members. Bengaluru’s favourite millennial hub, the Samsung Opera House hosted a special event for K-pop fans in the city. The event was organized by one the most popular Korean fan group Indhangul.   The love for the youthful Korean music and K-dramas was evident as over 150 young fans joined in and participated in a range of activities around the K-culture.    There was screening of Korean content, K-drama quiz, singing and dance performances. ‘Guess the K-pop song with the help of emojis’ got the audience going with participants showing off their knowledge on K-pop culture.      Taking note of the huge popularity of K-content amongst its consumers especially millennials, Samsung recently introduced a wide range of Korean content, K-pop music and K-dramas on its My Galaxy App. TAGSKorean ContentMy Galaxy AppSamsung Opera House Corporate > Brand For any issues related to customer service, please go to samsung.com/in/support for assistance.
